label.text:
The "CV" column in the table above shows "OpSw" numbers, where the value "1."

is pre-pended to the OpSw Number.
OpSw value 0 = "T"hrown. OpSw value 1 = "C"losed.
This pane is intentionally left blank
Basic Operating Mode
Slot "Purging" Management
Locomotive and Slot Management
New Locomotive Management
Command Station Routes Management
Switch Control Message Management
Command Station Sounds Management
LocoNet Track Status Management
* - Indicates the "Factory Default" setting
Track Output Management
Programming Track Output Management
Command Station "Loco Reset" Button Management
Command Station Internal Storage Clearing Functions

NOTE:

In order for OpSw36, OpSw37, and/or OpSw39 operations to take effect, it may be necessary to

remove command station power or briefly place the command station into "OpSw" mode via its

front-panel switch.

Note also that JMRI's LocoNet Slot Monitor does not recognize the Command Station OpSw

operations which can clear the slots. It is best to shut down JMRI and re-start after

clearing the Command Station slot table via OpSw 36 or OpSw39 mechanisms.
JMRI cannot programmatically modify DCS240 OpSw40. Use a throttle with the DCS240 in "OpSw" mode.
JMRI cannot programmatically modify DCS210 OpSw40. Use a throttle with the DCS210 in "OpSw" mode.
These OpSw ought not be changed from factory default settings.
The OpSw settings below cannot be changed by this tool.
* - Indicates the "Factory Default" setting
Notes on DCS240 OpSw Settings

• The Command Station should be in "Run" mode when programming Command Station OpSw

    settings using this Roster entry.

    (There is some evidence that this tool can modify OpSw settings when the Command Station

    DCS240 switch is set for "OpSw" mode, but be careful to check for the desired result if

    using this roster entry when the DCS240 is set for "OpSw" mode.)

  • The documentation for DCS240 OpSw "factory default" settings are not consistent with at

    least one DCS240 device. This decoder definition shows the "factory default" settings

    from an actual DCS240.

  • When manipulating OpSws 36, 37, and/or 39, for the purpose of clearing internal

    storage of slots, routes, etc., it may be necessary to power-cycle the command station

    or to switch the command station to "Sleep" mode, momentarily, before returning to

    "Run" mode, after writing the the OpSw to the "C"losed state.

    The command station may fail to act upon the request if one of these operations is not done.

  • Note that JMRI's LocoNet Slot Monitor does not recognize the Command Station OpSw

    operations which can clear the slots.

    It is best to shut down JMRI and re-start after clearing the Command Station slot table

    using OpSw mechanisms.

  • The 'Global System Loco "Speed-step Mode" Default for New Loco Acquisition' item on the

    "Basic OpSw Settings" 'Sheet' will not be "colorized" to reflect the state of OpSw21,

    OpSw22 and OpSw23, due to limitations of JMRI's mechanisms.
Notes on DCS210 OpSw Settings

• The Command Station should be in "Run" mode when programming Command Station OpSw

    settings using this Roster entry.

    (There is some evidence that this tool can modify OpSw settings when the Command Station

    DCS210 switch is set for "OpSw" mode, but be careful to check for the desired result if

    using this roster entry when the DCS210 is set for "OpSw" mode.)

  • The documentation for DCS210 OpSw "factory default" settings are not consistent with at

    least one DCS210 device. This decoder definition shows the "factory default" settings

    from an actual DCS210.

  • When manipulating OpSws 36, 37, and/or 39, for the purpose of clearing internal

    storage of slots, routes, etc., it may be necessary to power-cycle the command station

    or to switch the command station to "Sleep" mode, momentarily, before returning to

    "Run" mode, after writing the the OpSw to the "C"losed state.

    The command station may fail to act upon the request if one of these operations is not done.

  • Note that JMRI's LocoNet Slot Monitor does not recognize the Command Station OpSw

    operations which can clear the slots.

    It is best to shut down JMRI and re-start after clearing the Command Station slot table

    using OpSw mechanisms.

  • The 'Global System Loco "Speed-step Mode" Default for New Loco Acquisition' item on the

    "Basic OpSw Settings" 'Sheet' will not be "colorized" to reflect the state of OpSw21,

    OpSw22 and OpSw23, due to limitations of JMRI's mechanisms.
This sheet intentionally un-populated. See the "OpSws" tab.
